intro: Isodon coetsoides, commonly known as the African germander, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stem. Isodon coetsoides is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic properties.
